title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 104.4 - Use of temporary registration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 104.4 - Use of temporary registration

State Regulations
A temporary registration may be issued by a validly
registered boat dealer when a boat is sold or transferred. The registration
number to be affixed to the boat in conjunction with the temporary registration
shall be the registration number assigned to the boat by the dealer or, if the
boat was previously registered in this State, the previous registration number
shall be retained and displayed. No validating sticker will be issued with the
temporary registration. The temporary registration certificate completed by the
dealer must be on board the boat. The temporary registration certificate shall
be valid for 45 days after the date of its issuance by the
dealer. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
104.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
